formattedAddress: #B2-63, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands (2 Bayfront Ave)
location.address: #B2-63, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands

tips.text: Service has lots of room for improvement! No tea refills, no bowls?! Food not on par with other outlets.
A wide range of Japanese restaurant serving ramen, teppanyaki, soba, izakaya, etc.
Great view of the Marina Bay Sands. Nice open view at the upstairs bar.
Pork cheeks are heavenly! Limited!!! While stocks last!
Brown rice salad with some chicken and assorted veggies is good here. Really healthy options, but nice big portions also.
Lawry's Cut is very worth the price! In short it's one of the best steakhouse around! Service is attentive, sincere, helpful and friendly! Love it!

venue.name: Sun With Moon Japanese Dining & Café

tips.text: the tofu cheesecake is nice, very smooth.

formattedAddress: Japan Food Town (@ Level 4 Wisma Atria) (435 Orchard Road)
location.address: Japan Food Town (@ Level 4 Wisma Atria)

tips.text: Going back! Great variations on Saba fish!
Happy Hour Mortini Nights every Mon-Fri from 5-7pm. The martinis are large, good, and reasonably priced (around $12) with free steak sandwiches on top. Good to go early cos the place fills up fast!
All the food is good here, but the Akashi bento is a good and cost effective meal.
Always a joy when we go to lukes.  An awesome place for an intimate celebration

formattedAddress: Level 57 Sands SkyPark, Marina Bay Sands Hotel Tower 1 (10 Bayfront Ave.)
location.address: Level 57 Sands SkyPark, Marina Bay Sands Hotel Tower 1

tips.text: الفيو خرافي ،، في أحلى فندق في سنغافورة ،، ما أتذكر جودة الأكل صراحة .. What a view
The hotel and facilities are supposed to be 5-star but large number of incentive groups participate at the time of our visit. Breakfast at the hotel abit noisy...
Great night. Stunning views, great beers, fantastic food. Better than the hype suggests.
Great mezes and nice Australian wine

formattedAddress: Level 3 Pan Pacific Singapore (7 Raffles Blvd.)

tips.text: Champagne Brunch. Great selection and lotsa wine and beer!!!
If you're ordering takeaway, call ahead to order: 6473 3396.
Grab a seat at the wine bar – you can choose from over 100 Italian bottles – to witness the pies being cooked to crispy, bubbly perfection.
Grilled pusit is so yummy 😋😋😋
The dry mutton is special.
Amazing brunch with free flow of Ruinart Champagne mmmmmm ❤❤❤

formattedAddress: Lobby Level, Royal Plaza on Scotts (25 Scotts Rd.)
location.address: Lobby Level, Royal Plaza on Scotts

tips.text: Chocolate Fondue with everything!

formattedAddress: Lv 3, The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore (7 Raffles Avenue)

tips.text: 음식보단 분위기. 하지만 합리적인가격은 매력적임.
Better if you make a reservation before. Nice food and atmosphere. Drinks are huge; frozen margaritas a must try 👌🏽

venue.name: Lei Garden Restaurant 利苑酒家

tips.text: 2 pair of chopsticks ： interesting! One to eat; the other one to pick foods
The best Tonkatsu in Singapore, hands down. Service is good and the set menu includes green tea ice cream as desert.
Love the music, great spot for family's/childeren. There is a cosy pool. Delicious food so good choice of my frienda.
The walnut loaf. OMG. Its da bomb. Managed to buy it fresh at 12pm. Woooot

formattedAddress: 5th Level, Terrace Wing, Grand Hyatt Singapore (10 Scotts Road)
location.address: 5th Level, Terrace Wing, Grand Hyatt Singapore

tips.text: Weekend BBQ buffet with endless flow of prosecco, margaritas, beers, juices and soft drinks! Not to mention the bbq lamb, beef, sausages, prawns n a whole lot more! *BURP*
don't let the waiter/waitress recommed for you as you will be surprise for the price!
Which cafe doesn't open on a Public holiday? Apparently curious palate doesn't.
Pretty clean Scandic lines, reminds me of ann siang's kki with dainty pasties & elaborate eclairs. French chocolate in a piccolo demitasse. Smack in the cbd, but not too busy after work hours.
Drinks, and the baristas, are clever & may be the place to surround yourself in, on weekends. It has terrific 360 views & happy chatter. It makes for a good perch, stokes writers & un-blues. Fave.
Truffle Butter!!!

formattedAddress: #B1-48, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands (2 Bayfront Avenue)
location.address: #B1-48, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands

tips.text: The Seafood Platter is probably one of the best starters! It consists of oysters, lobster, crab, mussels, shrimps, and snails. You gonna enjoy it while dining in with your friends.

venue.name: Din Tai Fung 鼎泰豐 (Din Tai Fung)

formattedAddress: #B1-08, Raffles City Shopping Centre (252 North Bridge Rd)

tips.text: Try the 小菜!
Great pressure on the espresso machine, comes out great, balisimo!

formattedAddress: #03-21B Raffles City Shopping Centre (252 North Bridge Rd)

tips.text: Service extremely attentive and efficient. Recommendations on specials spot on.
Their Vadai is e best I've ever tasted.
Finally! The best pizza in Asia! High quality ingredients, you can taste each ingredient and they melt in the mouth. Napoletana with cheese, great option. Good environment and nice staff. Loved it.
Shark bone cartilage soup and roasted suckling pig are highlights. After eating the skin off the pig, the kitchen staff amazingly reassembled the chopped up remainder into a very presentable dish!
Good for business lunches or dinners. Private room available. Parking is easy.

venue.name: Ramen Keisuke Tonkotsu King Four Seasons

tips.text: Excellent ramen with generous portions of toppings.

formattedAddress: 229 Selegie Road (Opp Village Hotel Albert Court)

tips.text: LASALLE, SOTA & NAFA students get 15% discount here!
Flat whites are super good :) A must have!
Extraordinary food and impressive plating, good ambience, definitely a place worth revisiting!

formattedAddress: L2-01 The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands (10 Bayfront Ave)
location.address: L2-01 The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands

tips.text: The oyster for Tetsuya’s signature Marinated Botan Prawn, Sea Urchin and Oscietra Caviar is what dreams are made of!

formattedAddress: Shangri-La Hotel, Lower Lobby, Tower Wing (22 Orange Grove Rd)
location.address: Shangri-La Hotel, Lower Lobby, Tower Wing

tips.text: For those who drive, ask the waiter for complimentary parking. U have to go front desk to collect it.
Ginger Garden 내에 위치한 Halia 는 브런치가 유명한 레스토랑으로, 주말에는 10시부터 운영되는데 2005년 싱가포르 내에서 처음 선보인 칠리크랩 스파게티(28S$)가 유명하다... 메인 요리는 22S$부터 시작하며 토스트나 팬케이크는 18S$ 정도 한다. 여기 브런치 메뉴 중 칠리크랩은 "Must-Try" 해야 할 강추 메뉴~~!!!!

formattedAddress: #B1-42/46, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands (10 Bayfront Ave)
location.address: #B1-42/46, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands

tips.text: 오스테리아 모짜는 뉴욕의 이탈리아요리 전문가로 여러권의 책을 낸 스타셰프 Mario Batali 가 LA에 이어 싱가폴에 오픈한 레스토랑으로 대체로 가격대비 양은 적은 편이나 맛은 보장!! 가격은 코스 1인당 128S$부터, 파스타 24S$부터 시작.. 피자전문 레스토랑인 피제리아 모짜와 함께 운영되는데 가격은 피제리아가 저렴한 편이다...
